<div class="foundations-index-page">
    <header class="page-header">
        <h1 class="serif">Foundations of Fair Division</h1>
        <p class="page-description">
            Before diving into specific algorithms, it's essential to understand the mathematical criteria used to evaluate fairness. These foundational concepts will help you analyze any division procedure and understand the trade-offs between different approaches.
        </p>
    </header>

        <div class="topic-grid">
            <article class="topic-card fade-in">
                <div class="topic-header">
                    <h3><a href="{{ '/foundations/fairness-criteria/' | relative_url }}">Fairness Criteria</a></h3>
                    <div class="topic-badges">
                        <span class="difficulty-badge difficulty-fundamental">Fundamental</span>
                        <span class="status-badge status-complete">Available</span>
                    </div>
                </div>
                <div class="topic-content">
                    <p>Learn the mathematical definitions of proportionality, envy-freeness, Pareto efficiency, and strategy-proofness. Understand how these criteria relate to each other and why they matter in practice.</p>
                    
                    <div class="topic-highlights">
                        <h4>Key Concepts:</h4>
                        <ul>
                            <li>Proportional allocations (1/n guarantee)</li>
                            <li>Envy-free divisions (no jealousy)</li>
                            <li>Pareto efficiency (no waste)</li>
                            <li>Strategy-proof mechanisms</li>
                            <li>Trade-offs between criteria</li>
                        </ul>
                    </div>

                    <div class="topic-applications">
                        <strong>Applications:</strong> Legal settlements, resource allocation, game theory
                    </div>
                </div>
                <div class="topic-footer">
                    <a href="{{ '/foundations/fairness-criteria/' | relative_url }}" class="study-topic-btn">Study Fairness Criteria</a>
                </div>
            </article>

            <article class="topic-card fade-in coming-soon" style="animation-delay: 0.1s;">
                <div class="topic-header">
                    <h3>Mathematical Models</h3>
                    <div class="topic-badges">
                        <span class="difficulty-badge difficulty-intermediate">Intermediate</span>
                        <span class="status-badge status-coming">Coming Soon</span>
                    </div>
                </div>
                <div class="topic-content">
                    <p>Explore different mathematical models for representing resources and preferences, including divisible vs. indivisible goods, continuous vs. discrete models, and preference structures.</p>
                    
                    <div class="topic-highlights">
                        <h4>Key Concepts:</h4>
                        <ul>
                            <li>Continuous vs. discrete models</li>
                            <li>Preference representation</li>
                            <li>Valuation functions</li>
                            <li>Resource types and constraints</li>
                            <li>Complexity analysis</li>
                        </ul>
                    </div>

                    <div class="topic-applications">
                        <strong>Applications:</strong> Algorithm design, computational complexity
                    </div>
                </div>
            </article>

            <article class="topic-card fade-in coming-soon" style="animation-delay: 0.2s;">
                <div class="topic-header">
                    <h3>Game Theory Foundations</h3>
                    <div class="topic-badges">
                        <span class="difficulty-badge difficulty-advanced">Advanced</span>
                        <span class="status-badge status-coming">Coming Soon</span>
                    </div>
                </div>
                <div class="topic-content">
                    <p>Understand fair division through the lens of cooperative and non-cooperative game theory, including mechanism design and incentive compatibility.</p>
                    
                    <div class="topic-highlights">
                        <h4>Key Concepts:</h4>
                        <ul>
                            <li>Nash equilibria in division</li>
                            <li>Mechanism design principles</li>
                            <li>Incentive compatibility</li>
                            <li>Coalition formation</li>
                            <li>Strategic behavior</li>
                        </ul>
                    </div>

                    <div class="topic-applications">
                        <strong>Applications:</strong> Auction design, negotiation theory
                    </div>
                </div>
            </article>

            <article class="topic-card fade-in coming-soon" style="animation-delay: 0.3s;">
                <div class="topic-header">
                    <h3>Computational Complexity</h3>
                    <div class="topic-badges">
                        <span class="difficulty-badge difficulty-advanced">Advanced</span>
                        <span class="status-badge status-coming">Coming Soon</span>
                    </div>
                </div>
                <div class="topic-content">
                    <p>Analyze the computational requirements of fair division algorithms, including time complexity, query complexity, and algorithmic lower bounds.</p>
                    
                    <div class="topic-highlights">
                        <h4>Key Concepts:</h4>
                        <ul>
                            <li>Time and space complexity</li>
                            <li>Query complexity bounds</li>
                            <li>Approximation algorithms</li>
                            <li>Hardness results</li>
                            <li>Practical efficiency</li>
                        </ul>
                    </div>

                    <div class="topic-applications">
                        <strong>Applications:</strong> Algorithm optimization, implementation
                    </div>
                </div>
            </article>
        </div>

        <section class="learning-path-section fade-in" style="animation-delay: 0.4s;">

        <section class="quick-start-section fade-in" style="animation-delay: 0.5s;">
            <h2>Quick Start Guide</h2>
            <p>New to fair division? Here's how to get started:</p>
            
            <div class="quick-start-grid">
                <div class="quick-start-item">
                    <div class="quick-start-icon">📚</div>
                    <h4>1. Learn the Basics</h4>
                    <p>Start with <a href="{{ '/foundations/fairness-criteria/' | relative_url }}">Fairness Criteria</a> to understand what makes a division fair</p>
                </div>
                
                <div class="quick-start-item">
                    <div class="quick-start-icon">⚡</div>
                    <h4>2. See it in Action</h4>
                    <p>Try the <a href="{{ '/algorithms/divide-and-choose/' | relative_url }}">Divide-and-Choose Algorithm</a> with interactive examples</p>
                </div>
                
                <div class="quick-start-item">
                    <div class="quick-start-icon">🎯</div>
                    <h4>3. Practice</h4>
                    <p>Test your understanding with <a href="{{ '/exercises/' | relative_url }}">practice problems</a> and solutions</p>
                </div>
            </div>
        </section>

        <section class="why-foundations-section fade-in" style="animation-delay: 0.6s;">
            <h2>Why Start with Foundations?</h2>
            <div class="why-foundations-content">
                <div class="reason-item">
                    <h4>🎯 Clear Evaluation Criteria</h4>
                    <p>Understanding fairness criteria helps you evaluate any division algorithm and compare different approaches objectively.</p>
                </div>
                
                <div class="reason-item">
                    <h4>🔍 Deeper Algorithm Understanding</h4>
                    <p>When you know what properties algorithms are trying to achieve, you can better understand their design choices and limitations.</p>
                </div>
                
                <div class="reason-item">
                    <h4>🛠️ Problem-Solving Skills</h4>
                    <p>Mathematical foundations provide the tools to analyze new scenarios and design fair solutions for real-world problems.</p>
                </div>
                
                <div class="reason-item">
                    <h4>🌉 Bridge to Applications</h4>
                    <p>Theoretical understanding helps you see connections between abstract algorithms and practical applications in law, economics, and policy.</p>
                </div>
            </div>
        </section>
    </div>
